content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

You can solve this problem using the following Julia code:
```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    doc = Meta.parse(MD.parse(md))
    
    code_blocks = []
    for t in block_nodes(doc)
        if t.eltype == :fence && t.kwargs[:has] == "triple"
            push!(code_blocks, String(t.content[1].data))
        end
    end
    
    return join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```
This function first parses the Markdown document using the `MD.parse()` function from the `Markdown` package. Then it iterates over each block node in the parsed document and checks if the block is a code fence with triple backticks (denoted by the `:fence` keyword argument). If it is, the content of the code fence is appended to a list of code blocks. Finally, all the code blocks are joined together with newlines using the `join()` function and returned as a string.
